name: The Sad, Sad Tale of Chickenfoot
Backseat Drivers from Beyond the Stars
The Frycook What Came From All That Space

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

description: Hulk followers the Leader back in the victorian era and unites Frankensten's Monster. They must stop Dracula's evil plan to shroud the Earth with Leader's Gamma Furnace. This would allow vampires to haunt night and day.
name: Day of Future Smash: Part 3

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

description: Hulk teams up with young Captain America in WW2 to stop the Red-Skull who became the Green-Skull! In the present day, the Agents of S.M.A.S.H team up with old Captain America to free the world from Hydra led by Leader.
name: Days of Future Smash: Year of the Hydra: Part 4

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.
Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.
Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

deck: The Agents of S.M.A.S.H vs. Galactus and his new herald Firelord. Who will win?
description: The Agents must work with Ego the Living to fight off Galactus and his new herald, Firelord.
name: Planet Hulk, Part 2

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

description: The Agents of S.M.A.S.H and the Silver Surfer helps each other to stop Null from reaching a wormhole to Earth while facing their deepest fears. Can they do it?
name: Fear Itself

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

deck: The Agents of S.M.A.S.H and the Guardians of the Galaxy fighting together!!
description: The Agents of S.M.A.S.H and the Guardians of the Galaxy help each other to stop Skrulls and the Super Skrull from using their gamma ray for their newest plot on taking over Earth.
name: Guardians of the Galaxy

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

description: Hulk returns to Earth in a thousand years when High Evolutionary turned all men into Animal-Men. Can the Agents of S.M.A.S.H. save humankind?
name: Future Shock

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

deck: Connie trains with Pearl to be a sword fighter.
name: Sworn to the Sword
Like Giving Candy to a Baby

deck: Ronaldo does some investigative reporting on whether Steven and the Crystal Gems are safe for Beach City.
name: Rising Tides, Crashing Skies

series.name: Hulk and the Agents of S.M.A.S.H.

description: Six strangers wake up on a derelict ship with no memories. Who they really are will change them forever... and perhaps the universe, too.
name: Episode One

description: As the crew comes to terms with last episode's revelations about their respective pasts, they are faced with a dilemma: help the miners against insurmountable odds or abandon them to certain death.
name: Episode Two

description: When the ship mysteriously veers off course, suggestions of sabotage abound, fueling the onboard paranoia. A perilous spacewalk is required to bring the ship's systems back online. Meanwhile, Five makes a shocking discovery.
name: Episode Three

deck: Steven and the Gems find a dark secret when they revisit the Kindergarten.
name: Keeping it Together

deck: Final episode.
name: The Final Battle

series.name: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic

deck: Darth Vader is brought in to hunt down the Rebels.
description: After an absence while fighting with the rebel fleet, the Rebel crew returns to Lothal to save a defecting Imperial officer, only to be confronted by Darth Vader.
name: The Siege of Lothal

has_staff_review.name: Star Wars Rebels Episode 201: "The Siege of Lothal"

deck: Season finale.
name: Return of the Technodrome
The Boys Are Back In Town

description: Note: Master Splinter only makes a cameo appearance at the end of the episode.
name: Attack of the 50-Foot Irma

deck: From Texas to Japan, ordinary people begin to realize they can do extraordinary things.
description: A young girl named Claire enlists the help of a friend to videotape her surviving things that would kill a normal person. In Japan, Hiro, an office worker believes he can warp space and time with his mind. In Las Vegas, a single mother sees another version of herself in mirrors. In New York City, a nurse believes he can fly. And, in India, an academic who believes humanity is on the threshold of evolutionary change suddenly finds himself on the run from unknown stalkers.
name: Genesis

deck: Things take a dark turn as a fake exterminator breaks in on and attacks Suresh, Hiro is arrested, Mendez overdoses, Nikki has to dispose of two bodies, and a serial killer named Sylar strikes twice.
description: Claire continues to pursue questions about her parentage while avoiding the public scrutiny of her heroism in saving a man from the train wreck. Meanwhile the younger Petrelli brother is in the hospital following his "flying" escapade.
name: Don't Look Back

deck: Hiro proves his powers are real; Matt Parkman becomes a consultant for the FBI. Both Matt and Suresh are gaining in the quest to track down Sylar.
description:
Claire makes out with the football quarterback under the bleachers, but when he wants to go further than she does, disaster results.

Meanwhile Hiro convinces his friend that he's not crazy by enlisting his help in rescuing a girl. Then they set off for America to save New York.

Nikki finds a body in the desert and threatens her mother in law to stay away from her boy.

Nathan holds a press conference and claims Peter's suicidal.

Matt was a suspect in the Sylar murders until an interrogating agent realizes he has the power to read minds.

Suresh, and his father's neighbor uncover a hidden journal.

This episode written and produced by Jeff Loeb and featuring artwork by Tim Sale.
name: One Giant Leap

deck: The lives of the various "Heroes" begin to collide.
description:
Mr. Bennet and a mysterious Haitian have Officer Parkman strapped down to a table and monitored with machines. His mind reading powers don't work, and Bennet orders his mind be "cleaned out" when it becomes obvious he knows too much.

Ando almost gambles away all their money when Hiro stops time to rig the game. When he reveals to Ando what he's done, Ando convinces him that they need money for their mission and that using his powers for gambling is their best option. While Hiro and Ando use Hiro's powers to amass cash in the casinos, they come very close to running into Niki Sanders who's there to do something for the Mob, who're blackmailing her.

Claire Bennet lies on an autopsy table, but when the coroner removes a tree branch from her skull, she becomes sentient again and begins to heal. When the doctor leaves the lab she grabs a spare lab coat and escapes.
name: Collision

deck: Claire tells her father what Brody did to her. Matt tries to rekindle his marriage. Hiro meets Nathan for the first time. Peter and Isaac finish a painting together. Niki's husband may be coming for her. Nathan turns the tables on his blackmailers.
description:
Things start coming together as Ando meets Niki in her home (where the police mistake him for Niki's stalker husband who's believed to be in the area). Nathan also learns that Niki was hired to blackmail him. He escapes from Mr. Bennet by flying away, and later he lands near a diner where Hiro confronts him and tells him they're both "special".

Mr. Bennet threatens Brody for what he did to Claire.

In New York, Peter convinces Mohinder that a man named Hiro from the future has told him they have to return to Isaac's for answers. Once there Peter finishes Isaac's painting by cloning Isaac's powers.
name: Hiros

deck: The more "evolved humans" of 'Heroes' have to take drastic measures to ensure their survival.
description:
Present day Hiro calls Isaac's place and Peter answers the phone and tells him Future Hiro's message: "Save the cheerleader; save the world." So Hiro and Ando again try to set off for New York, but the man they cheated in poker forces them into one more game. Fearing they're to be killed, they hide in the bathroom, but when they emerge everyone has been violently slaughtered.

Mohinder decides to return to India, but Eden calls Mr. Bennet who tells her not to let him go. Bennet also sets up a meeting between Claire and her biological parents, which doesn't really give Claire any new insight to her abilities.

D.L. returns to Niki, but their relationship is still rocky, and Niki's life is further complicated by the woman in the mirror.
name: Better Halves

deck: When she learns D.L. has taken Micah, Niki asks Jessica to help. The Petrelli family has brunch with a journalist and Peter covers for his brother.
description:
Peter has a dream of Charles Deveaux and flying shortly before Simone shows up to tell him that Charles passed away. She also informs him that the painting he's looking for was sold to a man named Linderman.

The Petrelli family plan to have a strategic brunch with a reporter, but things get complicated when Peter shows up looking for help finding the painting.

Micah seems to have super powers related to controlling machines. He makes an out of order pay phone work to call his mom, Niki, but reaches her Jessica alter ego instead.

Matt Parkman helps Agent Hanson solve another evolved human case, and she in turn pulls some strings to allow him to retake the detective exam. But he may have blown his chances when he punches a superior after reading his mind and learning that he's been having an affair with Matt's wife.

D.L. and Hiro use their powers to save a man from a burning car.

Claire's younger brother Lyle discovers the tape of Claire's documented suicide attempts and freaks out.
name: Nothing to Hide

deck: Mohinder learns about his past; Hiro and Ando stop in a diner in Texas just before Sylar strikes there; Matt and Audrey interrogate the radioactive man; Mr. Bennet and Eden tell Isaac why they've kidnapped him; Claire prepares for the Homecoming dance.
description:
Mohinder returns to India to scatter his fathers' ashes. While he's there, he begins to have visions of the past, including one that shows his father's murder. He debates staying in India. His ex-girlfriend offers him a job in a genetics lab that she manages, as long as he promises not to continue, or even discuss, his father's research. He also learns that he had a sister who was "special" that died as a child.

Hiro and Ando stop at a diner in Texas where Sylar happens to be eating. They meet a waitress with the gift of perfect instant memory, but she is soon killed by Sylar and the local police tell them not to leave town. Hiro intends to go back in time to save her.

Officer Parkman and Agent Hanson interrogate Ted, the radioactive man, and learn that he and Matt were both visited by a Haitian before they blacked out; and both woke up with marks on the back of their necks.

Mr Bennet tries to get Isaac to paint a picture of when Sylar will kill Claire, but he can't do it without heroin, and he's fought too hard to get off the drug. Bennet then orders Eden to convince him to take heroin and paint the painting.
name: Seven Minutes to Midnight

deck: Peter reaches Ando by phone but learns that Hiro is no longer with him. The two agree to meet in Odessa before Sylar makes his move on the cheerleader. Claire is forbidden from going to Homecoming, but goes anyway. Meanwhile Jessica Sanders plans to kill D.L. with a recently purchased sniper rifle.
description:
Jessica Sanders is a dead shot with a rifle and she buys one from an arms dealer with the intent to eliminate D.L. D.L. tries to escape with Micah, but Niki/Jessica is hot on his trail. Micah convinces D.L. they have to go back for Niki.

In India, Mohinder gets closer to learning his father's secrets.

Nathan destroys one of Isaac's paintings allegedly for Peter's own good.

Claire wins the title for Homecoming Queen. To protect her, her father tries to ground her, but she sneaks out to go to Homecoming anyway; Eden refuses to give Isaac more drugs. Can Ando, HRG, Eden, Peter or the Haitian save her before Sylar gets her?
name: Homecoming

deck: Set six months before the beginning of the series, this episode tells the back story of the various characters.
description:
Flashing back to six months earlier, Hiro has traveled back in time to save the Midland, Texas waitress Charlie.

Claire's friend comes to tell Claire that she got a spot on the cheerleading squad. Initially Claire isn't overly excited, but when she threatens to give the position to someone else Claire grabs the uniform and in the ensuing struggle Claire's hand goes through a pane of glass. While Claire's mother takes them to the emergency room, Claire's father receives a call from a man who says they need to talk about Claire.

Hiro tries several times to persuade Charlie that he's from the future. He predicts a baseball game result, but she's unconvinced. He fulfills her tables orders in a blink of an eye and she's convinced he's a "magician". Finally he decorates the entire cafe with origami animals and she realizes there is something to his claims. He convinces her to go with him to Japan.

Dr. Suresh seeks out a watchmaker named Gabriel and tells him that he's special. Gabriel immediately believes him, feeling that he's always known this, but despite their best efforts neither can find how Gabriel is gifted (other than his ability to fix clocks), Going through Suresh's stuff, Gabriel learns the names and addresses of other supposedly evolved humans.

While Gabriel is at work, a man named Brian Davis enters arrives, looking for Dr. Suresh. Gabriel realizes that he's one of the evolved humans, and taking a name from a watch, tells him that he is "Sylar". Davis demonstrates his telekinetic powers for Sylar, then asks if Sylar can "fix" him. Sylar says yes, then strikes him in the back of the heat with a large quartz rock.

Meanwhile Dr. Suresh has met with Claire's father and convinces him that Claire has special abilities. Later Suresh meets with Gabriel-now-Sylar again and Sylar shows him his newly developed telekinetic powers.
name: Six Months Ago

deck: Sides are being drawn in the coming cataclysm and not several "heroes" begin questioning where there loyalties lie.
description:
Mr. Bennet reveals to Claire that he's known all along about her powers. He tells her to destroy the tapes she's made and tell no one else, not even her mother, about her special abilities.

Sylar is kept in a containment facility by Mr. Bennet. Eden says that she could make him kill himself and that that would be the best course of action, but Mr. Bennet tell her that's not in their orders. Nevertheless, she plans to do it anyway by giving Sylar a gun and persuading him to shoot himself.

Hiro and Ando realize that they've "saved the cheerleader" but not "saved the world", which brings up even more questions about Hiro's ability to actually change the future. They meet up with Isaac to compare notes and encourage Isaac to paint more.

Peter is held at the police station where he gets a visit from the Bennets as well as Officer Parkman and Agent Hanson. They realize that he's telling the truth about the events at the Odessa high school Homecoming.

Jessica tries to kill D.L., but he barely survives, thanks to his powers, long enough for Niki to get the upper hand.
name: Fallout

deck: Season 1, Episode 12. Two weeks after the events of last episode, Sylar is still in custody, Niki/Jessica is now in custody, and Peter Petrelli is still in a coma. Claire begins to suspect that her father is at the center of the mystery of everyone's memory loss, and a meeting with the Haitian confirms that. Meanwhile, Officer Parkman and Agent Hanson plan a raid on Mr. Bennet's paper company.
description:
The episode opens "Two Weeks Later". Peter Petrelli is in a coma. Simone comes to visit and Nathan argues with her. She insists that Peter believes in the prophecies of Isaac's paintings and she believes in him. Nathan tells her to take him to the studio where they are surprised to find Isaac alive. While there, Hiro and Ando show up.

Claire pretends to have had her mind wiped. In order to jog Zach's memory she again has him help her document her attempts at suicide. In a clandestine meeting with the Haitian, she learns that Peter is being watched, and he cautions her not to visit him in the hospital.

Matt and Audrey lead a raid on the paper company that Mr. Bennet uses as a front, but due to the presence of the Haitian, Parkman's powers are suppressed, and the raid proves fruitless. This leads to a breaking of the Matt and Audrey team. Matt returns home to tell his wife about his powers and try to reconcile their marriage.

Niki is imprisoned awaiting trial. When she learns that she's facing a death sentence, Jessica emerges and argues with her in front of her case worker in hopes of getting an insanity plea.

Due to Niki's confession to the murders that happened at the robbery, D.L, is no longer a wanted man, however Linderman's flunky tells him he still will may be called upon to do a favor someday to make things right.

Hiro and Ando find the sword Hiro believes is the key to his powers in the Museum of Natural History, but when they steal it they find it's just a replica.

Mr. Bennet visits Mohinder and informs him that Sarah AKA Eden was killed by Sylar and that he needs his help. He refuses to help Mr. Bennet but Bennet leaves his card in case he changes his mind.

By episode's end, both Ted and Jessica seem to be on track to be villains in the coming confrontation.
name: Godsend

deck: Episode 13; From the opening narration: When we embrace what lies within, our potential has no limit. The future is filled with promise, the present rife with expectation. But when we deny our instinct, and struggle against our deepest urges, uncertainty begins. Where does this path lead? When will the changes end? Is this transformation a gift, or a curse? For those who fear what lies ahead, the most important question of all: can we really ever change what we are?
description:
Peter confronts the Invisible Man who is violent and uncooperative. Peter is persistent despite the Invisible Man's death threats against him. Meanwhile, both Nathan and Molinder are looking for him Nathan agrees to join Molinder's search when Molinder tells him that Peter is the key, and by studying him they may be able to find a cure for their powers.

Niki, still in a padded cell refuses to cooperate with doctors, and demands more sedatives to keep Jessica under control. D.L. tries to explain to Micah that it's going to be a long time if ever before Niki is released. D.L. is desperate to get money to pay the rent, so Micah uses his machine powers to empty an ATM.

Matt Parkman's marriage is still shakey when he gets suspended for 6 months over the Odessa incident. He comes home to a major plumbing problem which he tackles himself. His wife reveals that she's pregnant.

With a cover story that they're working on a biology project on manatees, Claire and Zach begin researching Claire's biological parents. The Haitian reveals that she was rescued from a fire 14 years earlier and that he knows nothing about her father but her mother died in the fire. Through further research they find Meredith Gordon, her biological mother, still alive.

Hiro and Ando are eventually captured by their pursuers and taken to their boss, Hiro's father.

Mr. Bennet gets a call informing him that Sylar has died.
name: The Fix

deck: Sylar escapes from the paper factory. Claude tries to teach Peter how to control his powers. Claire meets her mother. Isaac contacts Mr. Bennet regarding Peter. Jessica is released from jail. Hiro must decide his future.
description:
Claude and Peter work on trying to control Peter's powers by walking around New York invisible and committing thefts Claude insists that Peter detach himself from all others like Nathan and Simone. To that end they follow Siimone invisibly to the same rooftop where Claude feeds the pigeons. There they witness her kissing Isaac.

Niki's therapist wants her to let Jessica out, and refuses to take no for an answer. She doesn't believe there's any danger, but even if there was, she informs Niki that the shackles on her wrists could hold back an elephant, and she is armed with a taser. Tje therapist uses hypnosis to bring Jessica out with disastrous results.

Sylar escapes, trapping Mr. Bennet in his cell in the process. He finds Mr. Bennet's drivers licence with his home address. He taunts Bennet, saying he's going to find Claire.

Simone shows up at Isaac's studio to return his key. Isaac warns her to stay away from Peter. The two argue. Simone sees one of Isaac's prophetic paintings showing them embracing romantically on the roof of her father's penthouse. They go there where they do kiss, while viewed by an invisible Claude and Peter.

Claire meets her mother in her trailer home in Kermit, Texas. The two reveal their powers to each other. Her mother promises to tell her who her father is the next time they meet.

Hiro's father insist he return to Japan immediately where he is to take up his birthright, running his father's company. Hiro has different ideas.
name: Distractions

deck: Episode 15: From the closing narration: To survive in this world, we hold close to those people on whom we depend. We trust in them our hopes, our fears. But what happens when trust is lost? Where do we run when things we believe in vanish before our eyes? When all seems lost, the future unknowable, our very existence in peril... all we can do is run.
description:
Meredith calls to tell Nathan that their daughter is still alive. Nathan assumes she is blackmailing him because he is running for office. He offers her $100,000 to keep quiet, and she agrees, promising $25,000 to Claire who gets mad because all she wants is to meet him. Claire hides and spies on the exchange, then throws a rock at Nathan's limo as he's driving away.

Matt Parkman is suspended from the LAPD, and working as private security. He is assigned to protect Aron Malsky, in town to do a diamond exchange, but he learns that Linderman has hired Jessica to kill Malsky. A firefight ensues at the diamond exchange, and Parkman "overhears" a conversation between Jessica and Niki. A pitched battle ensues.

Mohinder is successful in reaching one of the evolved humans by phone. Zane Taylor eagerly awaits his arrival. When Sylar shows up on the doorstep Taylor mistakes him for Dr. Suresh, and Sylar uses the opportunity to observe Zane's powers before he plans on killing him.

Hiro and Ando are in the kitchen of a hotel when they meet a crying woman named Hope. Ando falls for her and wants to help, but Hiro is reluctant until Ando persuades him. Dressed as bellhops they try to retrieve Hope's pink purse from her supposedly abusive ex-boyfriend's room in the hotel.

When Claire gets home her mother is traumatized and suffering severe memory loss, not even recognizing Claire or even her dog Mr. Muggles.

Episode directed by Roxann Dawson.
name: Run!

deck: Season 1, episode 16; "Unexpected". Two new heroes are introduced. Sylar kills again. Peter gains more control over his powers. Claire turns against her father when her mother's condition worsens.
description:
Ted Sprague is contacted via his computer (which is not connected to the Internet), by a woman who can access satellites and computers with her mind. She visits his cabin in the Nevada desert and convinces him that she and others have been kidnapped and had their memories erased just like him, and that the two should team up, she to track them down, and he to blow them up.

Claire's mother's condition worsens, leading to a collapse and hospitalization. Claire's father initially denies Claire's charges of erasing her memory, but when she admits to knowing about the Haitian, he just orders her to keep it to herself.

Isaac discovers that Peter can become invisible and tells Mr. Bennet. Bennet and the Haitian then attempt to recapture them, and Peter and Isaac fight over the betrayal and over Simone.

Hiro and the Gaming Commission Officer go looking for Ando and Hope. When they find them, a firefight ensues with Hiro and Ando hiding in the cargo hold of a charter bus.

Mrs. Parkman finds a diamond ring Matt hid in a drawer. He tells her that he got it for her. Later she goes to have the ring resized and the jeweler tells her that it is a $40,000 stolen diamond. The two argue, but Matt has to leave when an urgent call interrupts them.

Mohinder and Sylar (pretending to be Zane) travel to Montana where they find a woman named Dale who has superhuman hearing. She wants to know how they found her, and Mohinder tells her that she donated blood for scientific research once. She's busy but agrees to talk to them the next day. They go check in to a motel. During the night, Sylar returns and kills her.
name: Unexpected

deck: Season 1, Episode 17; Ted and Matt hold Mr. Bennet's family hostage and demand answers.
description:
The episode alternately takes place in the present, and in flashbacks (shot in black and white) to tell the story of Mr. Bennet and how events have led up to this point where Matt and Ted are holding the Bennet family hostage over alleged experiments performed upon them by Bennet.

The episode opens with Ted using his heat powers to melt their way into the Bennet house. There he and Matt start scouring the place for information when the entire Bennet family arrives home. Ted grabs a gun and takes them hostage as soon as they walk through the door.

Through a series of flashbacks we come to learn about how Bennet became involved with Primatech Paper and how he came to "adopt" Claire.

Ted holds Mr. Bennet's family hostage in their home while Matt escorts Bennet to Primatech to retrieve the information they seek, threatening to blow up the house if they aren't back within one hour.

The episode was ranked as #68 on TV Guide's top 100 Episodes of All Time.
name: Company Man

deck: "Parasite" is the eighteenth episode of the first season of Heroes. Following the death of Simone, Isaac blames Peter. Mr. Bennet is questioned about the disappearance of Claire. The Haitian tries to flee the country with Claire. Nathan helps Hiro and Ando acquire the sword. Jessica goes to kill Nathan, but Niki gets the upper hand and warns him. Mohinder and Sylar discuss the fate of the remaining evolved humans.
description:
Isaac blames Peter Petrelli for the death of Simone. Peter leaves and goes to tell Nathan who tells him they'll make an anonymous call to the police. Peter turns invisible and leaves, but not before learning that Nathan is working undercover with the FBI to catch Mr. Linderman.

Mr. Bennet is held at Primatech for questioning, but his memory has been wiped by the Haitian, as confirmed by Matt Parkman who's working for the organization in exchange for release.

Mr. Bennet's wife Sandra knows all about Primatech and the evolved humans, she gives him a note from himself saying not to look for her.

Hiro is unable to get to the room at the casino where the sword is kept until he runs into Nathan Petrelli who is in town working on the Linderman sting. Nathan gets Hiro past security, which allows him to finally get the sword.

Niki begins to get the upper hand over Jessica, she begins by leaving clues for D.L. She is unable to stop Jessica from killing the FBI agents working with Nathan Petrelli, but is able to warn Nathan before Jessica can kill him too.

Sylar continues to try to manipulate Mohinder, but Mohinder is on to him. He drugs Sylar and experiments on him.
name: Parasite

deck: ".07%" is the 19th episode of the 1st season of NBC's superhero drama series 'Heroes'. The title refers to the foretold cataclysm in New York City which will wipe out .07% of the world's total population.
description:
Discussing Nathan's political future, Mr. Linderman reveals that the future explosion in New York City is designed to secure his place as President of the United States. Nathan, however, has grave misgivings about the destruction of .07% of the world's population and the use of his brother as the catalyst.

Angela Petrelli plans to have Claire shipped off to Paris to secure Nathan's political future.

Mr. Bennet, Matt Parkman, and Ted Sprague, are prisoner's in the paper factory, but Bennet broadcasts his thoughts to Parkman, allowing the three to escape..

D.L. tries to take Micah, but Jessica and Mr. Linderman's cohorts manage to get ahold of him anyway.

Peter arrives at Dr. Suresh's apartment to find Mohinder being attacked by Sylar. Sylar kills Peter but Mohinder manages to escape with his body. He takes the body to the Petrelli mansion.

Hiro and Ando travel to the post-apocalyptic future.

deck: "Five Years Gone" is the twentieth episode of season one of Heroes, a superhero drama that originally aired on NBC. It's the last regular episode before the 3 part season finale.
description:
In this episode Hiro and Ando jump five years into the future, where they see what the world will be like if the explosion isn't stopped. Nathan Petrelli is president, Mr. Bennet is a fugitive who helps the evolved humans, Matt Parkman works for Homeland Security, and Future Hiro is the most wanted terrorist; Mohinder works for the president, as does the Haitian.

D.L. and Micah are "gone". Peter is now dating Niki Sanders who is a stripper, using the stage name of "Jessica" (who also happens to be gone).

Meanwhile Sylar is still on the loose.

This episode was originally known as "String Theory." The title was changed to "Five Years Gone". "String Theory" was used as the title of Chapter 30 of the Heroes graphic novel.
name: Five Years Gone

deck: "The Hard Part" is episode twenty one of the first season of the NBC superhero drama series Heroes. It's part one of a three-part finale. The title was Hiro's last line of the previous episode.
description:
The day before the election, Sylar uses Isaac's powers to paint a painting of a fight between himself and Ted, presumably leading to the nuclear explosion of New York. Sylar telephones Mohinder begging for his help, saying that he does not want to kill innocent people without powers, he just killed other evolved humans. Mohinder starts to believe him, but when Sylar hears him dialing '911' he hangs up and calls his mother instead.

Mr. Bennet's boss, Thompson convinces Mohinder to help his organization which is trying to stop Sylar. Mohinder is initially reluctant, but Thompson shows him Molly, a girl whose powers allow her to find people. Her power is suppressed by a blood borne illness which Mohinder may be able to cure with a transfusion from himself as his sister died of it, but he has the antibodies.

Hiro and Ando return from the future and go to get more information from Isaac, but find him dead and Sylar painting there. Sylar hears them with his super hearing, but Hiro teleports them a few minutes into the future, down on the street to escape.

Micah, is being held captive in a hotel room by Candice, pretending to be Niki.

Peter convinces Claire to stay in New York, and they become suspicious of Nathan when they see him talking to Thompson.

Sylar has a dramatic confrontation with his mother which deeply affects him.

DL and Jessica learn that Mr. Linderman has been spying on, and possibly manipulating them for years.

Hiro and Ando have a showdown with Sylar.
name: The Hard Part

deck: Season finale.
name: How to Stop an Exploding Man
